intro: Eriosema richardii var. ovatum, commonly known as the velvetleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy habitats and is often found in disturbed soils. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in ecological and horticultural contexts.
